alert.note: Alert for Boone; Cabell; Kanawha; Lincoln; Logan; Mingo; Wayne (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 06 at 12:42PM EDT until May 06 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Charleston has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Lawrence County in northeastern Kentucky... Boone County in central West Virginia... South Central Cabell County in central West Virginia... Central Kanawha County in central West Virginia... Lincoln County in central West Virginia... Logan County in southern West Virginia... Northwestern Mingo County in southern West Virginia... Wayne County in western West Virginia... * Until 500 PM EDT. * At 1242 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 2.5 inches are possible in the warned area, with higher localized amounts. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Charleston, Williamson, Madison, Louisa, Logan, Wayne, Hamlin, Montgomery, Chesapeake, Marmet, Belle, Chapmanville, Cedar Grove, East Bank, Glasgow, Fort Gay, Pratt, Delbarton, Spurlockville and Julian. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.

area.areaDesc: Boone; Cabell; Kanawha; Lincoln; Logan; Mingo; Wayne
